  33. ‌let parse_mod_use_file name lb =
  34.   let modname =
  35.     String.capitalize_ascii
  36.       (Filename.remove_extension (Filename.basename name))
  37.   in
  38.   let items =
  39.     List.concat
  40.       (List.map
  41.          (function Ptop_def s -> s | Ptop_dir _ -> [])
  42.          (!parse_use_file lb))
  43.   in
  44.   [ Ptop_def
  45.       [ Str.module_
  46.           (Mb.mk
  47.              (Location.mknoloc (Some modname))
  48.              (Mod.structure items)
  49.           )
  50.        ]
  51.    ]

  67. ‌let find_eval_phrase str =
  68.   let open Typedtree in
  69.   match str.str_items with
  70.   | [ { str_desc = Tstr_eval (e, attrs) ; str_loc = loc } ]
  71.   | [ { str_desc = Tstr_value (Asttypes.Nonrecursive,
  72.                                 [{ vb_expr = e
  73.                                  ; vb_pat = { pat_desc = Tpat_any; _ }
  74.                                  ; vb_attributes = attrs }])
  75.       ; str_loc = loc }
  76.     ] ->
  77.       Some (e, attrs, loc)
  78.   | _ -> None

  80. (* The current typing environment for the toplevel *)

  82. ‌let toplevel_env = ref Env.empty

  86. (* Generic evaluator and printer *)

  88. exception Undefined_global of string

  90. module type EVAL_BASE = sig

  92.   (* Return the value referred to by a base ident.
  93.      @raise [Undefined_global] if not found *)
  94. ‌  val eval_ident: Ident.t -> Obj.t

  96. end

  98. module MakeEvalPrinter (E: EVAL_BASE) = struct

  100. ‌  let rec eval_address = function
  101.     | Env.Aident id -> E.eval_ident id
  102.     | Env.Adot(p, pos) -> Obj.field (eval_address p) pos

  104. ‌  let eval_path find env path =
  105.     match find path env with
  106.     | addr -> eval_address addr
  107.     | exception Not_found ->
  108.         Misc.fatal_error ("Cannot find address for: " ^ (Path.name path))

  110. ‌  let eval_module_path env path =
  111.     eval_path Env.find_module_address env path

  113. ‌  let eval_value_path env path =
  114.     eval_path Env.find_value_address env path

  116. ‌  let eval_extension_path env path =
  117.     eval_path Env.find_constructor_address env path

  119. ‌  let eval_class_path env path =
  120.     eval_path Env.find_class_address env path


  123.   module Printer = Genprintval.Make(Obj)(struct
  124. ‌      type valu = Obj.t
  125.       exception Error
  126. ‌      let eval_address addr =
  127.         try eval_address addr
  128.         with Undefined_global _ ->
  129.           raise Error
  130. ‌      let same_value v1 v2 = (v1 == v2)
  131.     end)

  133. ‌  let print_untyped_exception ppf obj =
  134.     !print_out_value ppf (Printer.outval_of_untyped_exception obj)
  135. ‌  let outval_of_value env obj ty =
  136.     Printer.outval_of_value !max_printer_steps !max_printer_depth
  137.       (fun _ _ _ -> None) env obj ty
  138.   let print_value env obj ppf ty =
  139.     !print_out_value ppf (outval_of_value env obj ty)

  141.   (* Print an exception produced by an evaluation *)

  143.   let print_out_exception ppf exn outv =
  144.     !print_out_phrase ppf (Ophr_exception (exn, outv))

  146.   let print_exception_outcome ppf exn =
  147.     if exn = Out_of_memory then Gc.full_major ();
  148.     let outv = outval_of_value !toplevel_env (Obj.repr exn) Predef.type_exn in
  149.     print_out_exception ppf exn outv;
  150.     if Printexc.backtrace_status ()
  151.     then
  152.       match !backtrace with
  153.       | None -> ()
  154.       | Some b ->
  155.           print_string b;
  156.           backtrace := None

  158. ‌  type ('a, 'b) gen_printer = ('a, 'b) Genprintval.gen_printer =
  159.     | Zero of 'b
  160.     | Succ of ('a -> ('a, 'b) gen_printer)

  167. end


  170. (* Hook for initialization *)

  172. ‌let toplevel_startup_hook = ref (fun () -> ())

  174. type event = ..
  175. type event +=
  176.   | Startup
  177.   | After_setup

  179. let hooks = ref []

  181. let add_hook f = hooks := f :: !hooks

  183. let () =
  184.   add_hook (function
  185.       | Startup -> !toplevel_startup_hook ()
  186.       | _ -> ())

  188. let run_hooks hook = List.iter (fun f -> f hook) !hooks

  190. (* Helpers for execution *)

  192. type evaluation_outcome = Result of Obj.t | Exception of exn

  194. let record_backtrace () =
  195.   if Printexc.backtrace_status ()
  196.   then backtrace := Some (Printexc.get_backtrace ())

  198. let preprocess_phrase ppf phr =
  199.   let phr =
  200.     match phr with
  201.     | Ptop_def str ->
  202.         let str =
  203.           Pparse.apply_rewriters_str ~restore:true ~tool_name:"ocaml" str
  204.         in
  205.         Ptop_def str
  206.     | phr -> phr
  207.   in
  208.   if !Clflags.dump_parsetree then Printast.top_phrase ppf phr;
  209.   if !Clflags.dump_source then Pprintast.top_phrase ppf phr;
  210.   phr

  212. (* Phrase buffer that stores the last toplevel phrase (see
  213.    [Location.input_phrase_buffer]). *)
  214. ‌let phrase_buffer = Buffer.create 1024

  216. (* Reading function for interactive use *)

  218. ‌let first_line = ref true
  219. ‌let got_eof = ref false

  221. ‌let read_input_default prompt buffer len =
  222.   output_string stdout prompt; flush stdout;
  223.   let i = ref 0 in
  224.   try
  225.     while true do
  226.       if !i >= len then raise Exit;
  227.       let c = input_char stdin in
  228.       Bytes.set buffer !i c;
  229.       (* Also populate the phrase buffer as new characters are added. *)
  230.       Buffer.add_char phrase_buffer c;
  231.       incr i;
  232.       if c = '\n' then raise Exit;
  233.     done;
  234.     (!i, false)
  235.   with
  236.   | End_of_file ->
  237.       (!i, true)
  238.   | Exit ->
  239.       (!i, false)

  241. ‌let read_interactive_input = ref read_input_default

  243. ‌let refill_lexbuf buffer len =
  244.   if !got_eof then (got_eof := false; 0) else begin
  245.     let prompt =
  246.       if !Clflags.noprompt then ""
  247.       else if !first_line then "# "
  248.       else if !Clflags.nopromptcont then ""
  249.       else if Lexer.in_comment () then "* "
  250.       else "  "
  251.     in
  252.     first_line := false;
  253. ‌    let (len, eof) = !read_interactive_input prompt buffer len in
  254.     if eof then begin
  255.       Location.echo_eof ();
  256.       if len > 0 then got_eof := true;
  257.       len
  258.     end else
  259.       len
  260.   end

  262. ‌let set_paths ?(auto_include=Compmisc.auto_include) () =
  263.   (* Add whatever -I options have been specified on the command line,
  264.      but keep the directories that user code linked in with ocamlmktop
  265.      may have added to load_path. *)
  266.   let expand = Misc.expand_directory Config.standard_library in
  267.   let current_load_path = Load_path.get_paths () in
  268.   let load_path = List.concat [
  269.       [ "" ];
  270.       List.map expand (List.rev !Compenv.first_include_dirs);
  271.       List.map expand (List.rev !Clflags.include_dirs);
  272.       List.map expand (List.rev !Compenv.last_include_dirs);
  273.       current_load_path;
  274.       [expand "+camlp4"];
  275.     ]
  276.   in
  277.   Load_path.init ~auto_include load_path;
  278.   Dll.add_path load_path

  280. ‌let update_search_path_from_env () =
  281.   let extra_paths =
  282.     let env = Sys.getenv_opt "OCAMLTOP_INCLUDE_PATH" in
  283.     Option.fold ~none:[] ~some:Misc.split_path_contents env
  284.   in
  285.   Clflags.include_dirs := List.rev_append extra_paths !Clflags.include_dirs

  287. ‌let initialize_toplevel_env () =
  288.   toplevel_env := Compmisc.initial_env()

  290. external caml_sys_modify_argv : string array -> unit =
  291.   "caml_sys_modify_argv"

  293. ‌let override_sys_argv new_argv =
  294.   caml_sys_modify_argv new_argv;
  295.   Arg.current := 0

  297. ‌let is_command_like_name s =
  298.   not (String.length s = 0
  299.        || s.[0] = '-'
  300.        || Filename.basename s <> s
  301.        || Filename.extension s <> "")

  303. (* The table of toplevel directives.
  304.    Filled by functions from module topdirs. *)

  306. ‌type directive_fun =
  307.   | Directive_none of (unit -> unit)
  308.   | Directive_string of (string -> unit)
  309.   | Directive_int of (int -> unit)
  310.   | Directive_ident of (Longident.t -> unit)
  311.   | Directive_bool of (bool -> unit)

  313. ‌type directive_info = {
  314.   section: string;
  315.   doc: string;
  316. }

  318. ‌let directive_table = (Hashtbl.create 23 : (string, directive_fun) Hashtbl.t)

  320. ‌let directive_info_table =
  321.   (Hashtbl.create 23 : (string, directive_info) Hashtbl.t)

  323. ‌let add_directive name dir_fun dir_info =
  324.   Hashtbl.add directive_table name dir_fun;
  325.   Hashtbl.add directive_info_table name dir_info

  327. ‌let get_directive name =
  328.   Hashtbl.find_opt directive_table name

  330. ‌let get_directive_info name =
  331.   Hashtbl.find_opt directive_info_table name

  333. ‌let all_directive_names () =
  334.   Hashtbl.fold (fun dir _ acc -> dir::acc) directive_table []

  336. let try_run_directive ppf dir_name pdir_arg =
  337.   begin match get_directive dir_name with
  338.   | None ->
  339.       fprintf ppf "Unknown directive `%s'." dir_name;
  340.       let directives = all_directive_names () in
  341.       Misc.did_you_mean ppf
  342.         (fun () -> Misc.spellcheck directives dir_name);
  343.       fprintf ppf "@.";
  344.       false
  345.   | Some d ->
  346.       match d, pdir_arg with
  347.       | Directive_none f, None -> f (); true
  348.       | Directive_string f, Some {pdira_desc = Pdir_string s} -> f s; true
  349.       | Directive_int f, Some {pdira_desc = Pdir_int (n,None) } ->
  350.          begin match Misc.Int_literal_converter.int n with
  351.          | n -> f n; true
  352.          | exception _ ->
  353.            fprintf ppf "Integer literal exceeds the range of \
  354.                         representable integers for directive `%s'.@."
  355.                    dir_name;
  356.            false
  357.          end
  358.       | Directive_int _, Some {pdira_desc = Pdir_int (_, Some _)} ->
  359.           fprintf ppf "Wrong integer literal for directive `%s'.@."
  360.             dir_name;
  361.           false
  362.       | Directive_ident f, Some {pdira_desc = Pdir_ident lid} -> f lid; true
  363.       | Directive_bool f, Some {pdira_desc = Pdir_bool b} -> f b; true
  364.       | _ ->
  365.           let dir_type = match d with
  366.           | Directive_none _   -> "no argument"
  367.           | Directive_string _ -> "a `string' literal"
  368.           | Directive_int _    -> "an `int' literal"
  369.           | Directive_ident _  -> "an identifier"
  370.           | Directive_bool _   -> "a `bool' literal"
  371.           in
  372.           let arg_type = match pdir_arg with
  373.           | None                              -> "no argument"
  374.           | Some {pdira_desc = Pdir_string _} -> "a `string' literal"
  375.           | Some {pdira_desc = Pdir_int _}    -> "an `int' literal"
  376.           | Some {pdira_desc = Pdir_ident _}  -> "an identifier"
  377.           | Some {pdira_desc = Pdir_bool _}   -> "a `bool' literal"
  378.           in
  379.           fprintf ppf "Directive `%s' expects %s, got %s.@."
  380.             dir_name dir_type arg_type;
  381.           false
  382.   end

  384. (* Overriding exception printers with toplevel-specific ones *)

  386. ‌let loading_hint_printer ppf s =
  387.   Symtable.report_error ppf (Symtable.Undefined_global s);
  388.   let find_with_ext ext =
  389.     try Some (Load_path.find_uncap (s ^ ext)) with Not_found -> None
  390.   in
  391.   fprintf ppf
  392.     "@.Hint: @[\
  393.      This means that the interface of a module is loaded, \
  394.      but its implementation is not.@,";
  395.   (* Filenames don't have to correspond to module names,
  396.      especially for archives (cmas), which bundle multiple modules.
  397.      But very often they do. *)
  398.   begin match List.find_map find_with_ext [".cma"; ".cmo"] with
  399.   | Some path ->
  400.     fprintf ppf
  401.       "Found %s @,in the load paths. \
  402.        @,Did you mean to load it using @,#load \"%s\" \
  403.        @,or by passing it as an argument to the toplevel?"
  404.        path (Filename.basename path)
  405.   | None ->
  406.     fprintf ppf
  407.       "Did you mean to load a compiled implementation of the module \
  408.        @,using #load or by passing it as an argument to the toplevel?"
  409.   end;
  410.   fprintf ppf "@]"

  412. let () =
  413.   Location.register_error_of_exn
  414.     (function
  415.       | Symtable.Error (Symtable.Undefined_global s) ->
  416.         Some (Location.error_of_printer_file loading_hint_printer s)
  417.       | _ -> None
  418.     )
